## Creating a summary table



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# reading in the data

star <- readr::read_csv("https://drmankin.github.io/disc_stats/star.csv") |>
  dplyr::mutate(dplyr::across(dplyr::starts_with("star"), forcats::as_factor))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Rows: 2161 Columns: 48
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (28): gender, ethnicity, birth, stark, star1, star2, star3, lunchk, lunc...
dbl (20): readk, read1, read2, read3, mathk, math1, math2, math3, experience...

```

:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library("tidyverse")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.4     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.4     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
star |> 
  dplyr::group_by(star2) |> 
  dplyr::summarise(
    n = dplyr::n(),
    min = min(math2, na.rm = TRUE),
    max = max(math2, na.rm = TRUE),
    mean = mean(math2, na.rm = TRUE), 
    median = median(math2, na.rm = TRUE),
    sd = sd(math2, na.rm = TRUE),
    CI_lower = mean_cl_normal(math2)$ymin,
    CI_upper = mean_cl_normal(math2)$ymax
  ) |> 
  knitr::kable(digits = 3)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}


|star2        |   n| min| max|    mean| median|     sd| CI_lower| CI_upper|
|:------------|---:|---:|---:|-------:|------:|------:|--------:|--------:|
|small        | 813| 488| 721| 597.086|    596| 44.357|  594.033|  600.140|
|regular      | 625| 490| 721| 591.486|    587| 42.912|  588.116|  594.857|
|regular+aide | 723| 497| 721| 595.396|    593| 41.852|  592.340|  598.451|
